title: Federation of Evangelical Churches in Italy
text:
The Federation of Evangelical Churches in Italy (, FCEI) is an ecumenical <a href="Protestantism">Protestant</a> body in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>.
History.
The FCEI, formed in 1967, includes the historical Protestant churches of Italy, that is to say the <a href="Union%20of%20Methodist%20and%20Waldensian%20Churches">Union of Methodist and Waldensian Churches</a> (a <a href="United%20and%20uniting%20churches">united</a> denomination comprising the <a href="Waldensian%20Evangelical%20Church">Waldensian Evangelical Church</a> and the <a href="Methodist%20Evangelical%20Church%20in%20Italy">Methodist Evangelical Church</a>, 35,000 members), the <a href="Baptist%20Evangelical%20Christian%20Union%20of%20Italy">Baptist Evangelical Christian Union of Italy</a> (15,000), the <a href="Lutheran%20Evangelical%20Church%20in%20Italy">Lutheran Evangelical Church in Italy</a> (7,000), and other minor churches. The body includes also two observer members with a large following: the <a href="Federation%20of%20Pentecostal%20Churches%20%28Italy%29">Federation of Pentecostal Churches</a> (50,000 members) and the <a href="Italian%20Union%20of%20Seventh-day%20Adventist%20Christian%20Churches">Italian Union of Seventh-day Adventist Christian Churches</a> (25,000). The FCEI has a total membership of 140,000.
